bug.author: goswamig
bug.summary: AWS Kubeflow installation instruction is broken
bug.description:
/kind bug
I followed the instruction from <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow/</denchmark-link>
What did you expect to happen: I expected the installation of kubeflow. Anything else you would like to add: I have modified the region and roles <denchmark-code> kfctl apply -V -f ${CONFIG_FILE} Error: unknown shorthand flag: 'f' in -f Usage: kfctl apply [all(=default)|k8s|platform] [flags]
Flags: -h, --help help for apply -V, --verbose verbose output default is false
unknown shorthand flag: 'f' in -f gauta@38f9d3e5a5af:~/kubeflow/gautam-1$ echo $CONFIG_FILE /Users/gauta/kubeflow/gautam-1/kfctl_aws.yaml </denchmark-code>
Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard):
kfctl version: (use kfctl version): kfctl_v1.0-rc.3-1-g24b60e8_darwin.tar.gz
Kubernetes platform: EKS
Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): 1.14
OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): macOS
